description: The Pulumi File Provider enables you to create files either locally or remotely as part of the Pulumi resource model.
name: file

file:remote:File.description: A file to be created on a remote host. The connection is established via ssh.

connection.description: The parameters with which to connect to the remote host.

path.description: The path for file on remote server

sftpPath.description: sudo mode requires a external sftp server to be running on remote host

triggers.description: Trigger replacements on changes to this input.

useSudo.description: if enabled then use sudo for copy command instead of direct copy

connection.description: The parameters with which to connect to the remote host.

md5sum.description: The md5sum of the uploaded file

path.description: The path for file on remote server

sftpPath.description: sudo mode requires a external sftp server to be running on remote host

triggers.description: Trigger replacements on changes to this input.

useSudo.description: if enabled then use sudo for copy command instead of direct copy

file:remote:Connection.description: Instructions for how to connect to a remote endpoint.

agentSocketPath.description: SSH Agent socket path. Default to environment variable SSH_AUTH_SOCK if present.

dialErrorLimit.description: Max allowed errors on trying to dial the remote host. -1 set count to unlimited. Default value is 10.

host.description: The address of the resource to connect to.

password.description: The password we should use for the connection.

perDialTimeout.description: Max number of seconds for each dial attempt. 0 implies no maximum. Default value is 15 seconds.

privateKey.description: The contents of an SSH key to use for the connection. This takes preference over the password if provided.

privateKeyPassword.description: The password to use in case the private key is encrypted.

proxy.description: The connection settings for the bastion/proxy host.

user.description: The user that we should use for the connection.

file:remote:ProxyConnection.description: Instructions for how to connect to a remote endpoint via a bastion host.

agentSocketPath.description: SSH Agent socket path. Default to environment variable SSH_AUTH_SOCK if present.

dialErrorLimit.description: Max allowed errors on trying to dial the remote host. -1 set count to unlimited. Default value is 10.

host.description: The address of the bastion host to connect to.

password.description: The password we should use for the connection to the bastion host.

perDialTimeout.description: Max number of seconds for each dial attempt. 0 implies no maximum. Default value is 15 seconds.

port.description: The port of the bastion host to connect to.

privateKey.description: The contents of an SSH key to use for the connection. This takes preference over the password if provided.

privateKeyPassword.description: The password to use in case the private key is encrypted.

user.description: The user that we should use for the connection to the bastion host.
